Cat.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A. First checkpoint in act 3. Walk down the hill and find Yenna and her cat to the right.

Introduction.synopsis: The player meets Yenna for the first time. This first interaction is forced so that even an evil player can become attached to her as we need them to form a connection for Yenna to be a potential target for Orin.
Introduction.how_to_trigger: BGO_Main_A. First checkpoint in act 3. Walk down the hill and find Yenna and her cat to the right.

Cat_10.speaker: Player
Cat_10.text: Peer into the cat's eyes. Does it know anything about Yenna's mother's fate?

Cat_11.speaker: Narrator
Cat_11.text: *The cat peers back. You read something in its eyes: doubt. Resignation, perhaps.*

Cat_1.speaker: Player
Cat_1.text: You sense this is a reticent cat - gain its trust by ignoring it.

Cat_18.speaker: Narrator
Cat_18.text: *The cat remains cautious, but there's a look in its eyes: worry.*

Cat_27.speaker: Grub
Cat_27.text: I'm just a Cat! P-please! Talk to Yenna.

Cat_2.speaker: Player
Cat_2.text: I'm not going to hurt you, kitty.

Cat_26.speaker: Grub
Cat_26.text: Y-Yenna is my best friend. She's kind. H-help her, not me!

Cat_5.speaker: Player
Cat_5.text: Do you know what happened to Yenna's mother?

Cat_29.speaker: Grub
Cat_29.text: N-nothing good, I don't think. She was so very sick. M-maybe she made like a Cat and went off to... to spend her last life.

Introduction_30.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_30.text: Hi! I'm still looking for my mum but - erm - thank you for helping me. You were really nice.

Introduction_55.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_55.text: Erm. 'Scuse me. I can't find my mum.

Introduction_31.speaker: Player
Introduction_31.text: Where did you last see her?

Introduction_63.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_63.text: She was. Erm. She was sick. She had spots on her face and hands. She went to go get some herbs - and she was supposed to come back the same day.
Introduction_63.context: NodeContext: Responding to 'where did you last see your mum?'

Introduction_39.speaker: Player
Introduction_39.text: I don't know where your mum is, but here - take a few coin. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Introduction_4.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_4.text: Oh - erm. Thank you so much! I don't have anything and you can't do anything without any coin.

Introduction_60.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_60.text: I'll pay you back. When I find my mum.

Introduction_3.speaker: Player
Introduction_3.text: You must be hungry. Take some food.

Introduction_15.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_15.text: Wow! Thanks! My mum would like this. She's the best cook in the world. And she taught me too.

Introduction_28.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_28.text: I'll - erm - I'll look for her. I think she'll probably come soon.

Introduction_21.speaker: Player
Introduction_21.text: Let's go find a guard. They'll be able to help you.

Introduction_46.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_46.text: Guards blow like petards. They don't help us.

Introduction_20.speaker: Halsin
Introduction_20.text: This city is a poor place to be in need of help. Even the guards can't be trusted to protect the most vulnerable.

Introduction_68.speaker: Player
Introduction_68.text: It sounds like your mum is probably dead.

Introduction_56.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_56.text: That means you don't come back. My mum is coming back, though. She's looking for me.

Introduction_73.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_73.text: If you see her, tell her Yenna's looking for her. It's really scary when you're alone without your mum.

Introduction_62.speaker: Player
Introduction_62.text: Let's find the nearest temple, little one. They can help you, I'm sure.

Introduction_35.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_35.text: That's the first thing I did - mum always said to look for a temple if I needed help.

Introduction_17.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_17.text: But they... they said they couldn't help me. 'Cos of the circ... circum... circumstances. That's what they said.
Introduction_17.context: NodeContext: like a kid trying to remember a big word they've heard for the first time

Introduction_33.speaker: Player
Introduction_33.text: Conjure some berries and herbs for the hungry child.

Introduction_9.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_9.text: Oh wow! Thank you... Mum loved food like this. 'Simple is best,' she always said.
Introduction_9.context: NodeContext: 'simple is best' as if repeating a maxim taught by her mother

Introduction_70.speaker: Halsin
Introduction_70.text: Poor child. I can only hope her mother does return - she should not be left alone here.

Introduction_67.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_67.text: Yenna! And my cat is Grub. He's shy. I'm not.

Introduction_10.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_10.text: My mum is called Emery. She went to go get some herbs - for her spots. She was sick. And she was supposed to come back the same day.

Introduction_58.speaker: Player
Introduction_58.text: Tell me where she went, little one - I can try tracking her down.

Introduction_48.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_48.text: She went looking for herbs. That's what she said. Said it was for the spots... she had them all on her hands and face.

Introduction_77.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_77.text: She said she wouldn't be gone long... but that was a whole tenday ago.

Introduction_7.speaker: Narrator
Introduction_7.text: *The herbs you know for salving sores would take effect immediately. It seems unlikely this child's mother will return.*

Introduction_16.speaker: Player
Introduction_16.text: Here, I have some rations to spare. Eat up, child.

Introduction_54.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_54.text: Th - thank you! I was getting hungry. Mum made a big stew before she left - she's the best cook ever - but I ate it all.

Introduction_0.speaker: Player
Introduction_0.text: I think your mum will be gone for a while. Maybe best find somewhere safe to stay?

Introduction_57.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_57.text: It does get quite cold out here... I - erm - I'll have another look for her first.

Introduction_74.speaker: Player
Introduction_74.text: Best stay put, child.  I'll have a look for your mother.

Introduction_26.speaker: Player
Introduction_26.text: That's your problem, kid. Get lost.

Introduction_71.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_71.text: But - erm. I'm. I don't know where to go.

Introduction_44.speaker: Lae'zel
Introduction_44.text: If 'get out' not clear enough for you, child, perhaps a flash of my weapon will get the message across.

Introduction_51.speaker: Shadowheart
Introduction_51.text: Harsh. Not the family type then, I take it?

Introduction_69.speaker: Astarion
Introduction_69.text: Good, that'll make 'getting lost' even easier. Honestly, kids these days.

Introduction_45.speaker: Wyll
Introduction_45.text: Come now, have a heart. She's only a child.

Introduction_52.speaker: Gale
Introduction_52.text: A tad harsh, don't you think? Our fire will be no cooler just for sharing it with a child in need.

Introduction_36.speaker: Karlach
Introduction_36.text: Ah, come on. What's with you? We have room. Kid needs us.

Introduction_19.speaker: Halsin
Introduction_19.text: She is a child in need of help - let your harsh words go unspoken.
Introduction_19.context: NodeContext: Reprimanding the player for being dismissive of a child in need.

Introduction_8.speaker: Jaheira
Introduction_8.text: Watch your tongue. The girl has suffered cruelty enough without heaping more on her head.
Introduction_8.context: NodeContext: Snapping at player for bullying child.

Introduction_27.speaker: Player
Introduction_27.text: Just stay put, kid. Your mum will come find you soon, I'm sure.

Introduction_24.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_24.text: She better. It's getting really sad in here.

Introduction_23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Introduction_23.text: The child ignores you. Would you like me to dispose of her?

Introduction_64.speaker: Yenna
Introduction_64.text: Oh - erm - hi. My mum is coming - I think.
